action.action-desc: Mr. Hunter (for himself, Mr. McGovern, Mr. Graves of Missouri, Mrs. Bustos, Mrs. Dingell, and Mr. Rothfus) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Veterans' Affairs

form.official-title: To amend title 38, United States Code, to direct the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to increase certain veteran funeral benefits, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Burial Rights for America’s Veterans’ Efforts Act of 2017 or the BRAVE Act of 2017.

section.header: Increase to certain funeral benefits under laws administered by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs

subsection.text: Section 2302(a) of title 38, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking $300 and inserting $749 (as increased from time to time under subsection (c)); and
by adding at the end the following new subsection:

subsection.text: With respect to any fiscal year, the Secretary shall provide a percentage increase (rounded to the nearest dollar) in the maximum amount of burial and funeral expenses payable under subsection (a) equal to the percentage by which—

paragraph.text: the Consumer Price Index (all items, United States city average) for the 12-month period ending on the June 30 preceding the beginning of the fiscal year for which the increase is made, exceeds
the Consumer Price Index for the 12-month period preceding the 12-month period described in paragraph (1).

subsection.text: Section 2307 of such title is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking In any case and inserting the following:
by striking $2,000 and inserting $2,000 (as increased from time to time under subsection (b)); and
by adding at the end the following new subsection:

subsection.text: With respect to any fiscal year, the Secretary shall provide a percentage increase (rounded to the nearest dollar) in the maximum amount of burial and funeral expenses payable under subsection (a) equal to the percentage by which—

paragraph.text: the Consumer Price Index (all items, United States city average) for the 12-month period ending on the June 30 preceding the beginning of the fiscal year for which the increase is made, exceeds
the Consumer Price Index for the 12-month period preceding the 12-month period described in paragraph (1).

subsection.text: The amendments made by this Act shall apply to deaths that occur after the day that is one year after the date of the enactment of this Act.
